intro: Pseudima pallidum, commonly known as the pale false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Pseudima pallidum is noted for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting local insect populations.
